message: Often implementations are hidden behind interfaces. Clients only see the interface with its documentation. So if an implementation makes a note that it is partly CPU bound and UI should use Task.Run around it, the client would not be aware of this. Furthermore the client interprets it as a natural async method due to the interface design and omits the Task.Run, leading to a temporary UI freeze. How should this situation be handled because I think it is a quite common situation. Doesn't it violate the LSP?
